page.title: 05PEAT AND ITS USE
page.content:
Peat is a brown turf that covers most of the Highlands.The Highlands used to be covered by great forests. When they died the trees and other plants were pressed down by new growth which fell in its turn.After thousands of years this formed into peat.
The crofters cut it with a knife.This knife has a long handle.It is called a taishker (tairsgearl).In this area people cut peat for burning.They harvest in spring and let it dry during the summer then it is ready to be burned.
In other parts of the country they have big machines and they get the peat and sell it to people or to power stations to make electricity for thousands of people.
